Victor Pessoa de Azevedo Lia Fook

I am a brazilian computer programmer and I have been working with web development since 2010, when I got my first job.

In 2011 I got a Bachelor's Degree in Computing, in Universidade Federal do Cear√° - UFC, where I learned all the computational bases and principles as algorithms, data structures, logics and many other amazing subjects which made me fell definitely in love with Computer Science.

In 2014 I got a MBA in IT Governance, in Universidade de Fortaleza - UNIFOR, in which I learned more about organisational skills, processes and quality - Much important in software development lifecycle.

During all these years I got well versed in many languages and technologies, such as PHP, Java, Javascript, C, SQL, HTML, CSS, among others. It is also important to stay up to date, so I have a grasp on some modern frameworks such as AngularJs, Bootstrap and package managers such as NPM and Bower. They help a lot on agile development!

I am really into problem solving and I enjoy websites like Hackerrank - It helps not to get rusty.

For more details about my professional experience, please take a look at my LinkedIn profile or my CV.

Australia

In 2012 I decided that I would live in Australia. Lucky me, I am a programmer. Every year the Australian Government makes a list with many occupations they lack in their labour market. Software Developers usually are included in that list.

Next step, I needed to know how to speak English. After hard work and some unsuccessful attempts, I managed to pass on IELTS Exam with an overall band of 8.0 with no skill below 7.0. That's a requirement to be entitled to an Australian Skilled Visa.

After some waiting and money spent I finally got a Permanent Resident visa, which gives me right to work and live here in Australia!
